Module External::Io
In: lib/external/io.rb

Adds functionality to an IO required by External.

IO adds/overrides the length accessor for getting the size of the IO contents. Note that length is not automatically adjusted by write, for performance reasons. length must be managed manually, or reset after writes using reset_length.

Methods

<=>   concat   copy   extended   insert   quick_compare   reset_length   scan   sort_compare   truncate  

Included Modules

Public Instance methods

<=>(another)

Alias for sort_compare.

concat(src, range=0..src.length)
copy(mode="r", range=0..length) {|cp| ...}
insert(src, range=0..src.length, pos=nil)
quick_compare(another)

Quick comparision with another IO. Returns true if another == self, or if both are file-type IOs and their paths are equal.

reset_length()

Resets length to the length returned by Utils.length

scan(range_or_span=default_span, blksize=default_blksize, carryover_limit=default_blksize) {|scan_begin, string| ...}
sort_compare(another, blksize=default_blksize)

Sort compare (ie <=>) with another IO, behaving like a comparison between the full string contents of self and another. This obviously can be a long operation if it requires the full read of two large IO objects.

truncate(n)

Modified truncate that adjusts length
